Title: Finally an update - about time hey?
Summary: The latest update since the last one and half years ago..
Body:
As you can probably tell, I don't add blog posts very often and this is perhaps related to the fact that I still haven't gotten around to completing the blog editor project. TBH, I don't have any motivation to complete that as I don't really blog.... A vicious cycle as you can probably tell. simplegoblog was my first go project quite afew years back. If I was to do it again, it would be nothing like the way it is now - but as I or no one else really uses it, there is not much point in changing anything. I will get around to converting the UI to a Hugo theme and transition to that as it just makes much more sense. I only found Hugo as I was considering going down a similar road with simplegoblog and after a very quick search found it (this was a while back). I'm working on too many things at the moment that are more important than another blog engine.

I just completed a very quick little tool that I have put up on github called gomost that enabled you to host multiple applications/sites from the one box. You can host each site using static files, proxying to some other app or embedding an app within it - or a mixture of them all. I created it as I needed something for all my holding pages and little apps that I now use but could be ran on one simple VPS. I'm currently hosting them all on a $5 Digital Ocean box. Gomost can be setup from one simple configuration file along the lines of:


prod: false
addr: :8080
loglevel: trace
static: ./static
proxies:
  -
    proxy: www.dev1.com
    host: http://localhost:8090
  -
    proxy: www.dev2.com
    host: http://localhost:8091
ssl:
  redirecthttp:
    enable: true
    addr: :8080
  DisableLetsEncrypt: false

I have added the ability to get automatic SSL certs using letsencrypt - which is enabled by default. I have not added any tests yet and I know there is the possibility of defining incorrect address in combinations that would not make sense. I will get around to adding these tests so people can rest assured it will work as expected. I am currently using it to host all my holding pages and to proxy traffic to this blog. HTTPS is now enabled by default - take a look - it is provided by letsencrypt.

I've also updated the deployment to use Docker now. The apps are each Dockerized and the entire app is deployed using docker compose to make things a little easier. I have to say, I can see how I'm going to make more use of Docker in the day job. I should have done this ages ago.

So in the months to come, I will be completing a big side project that I've been working on for a while now. I'll hopefully get around to moving this blog over to using Hugo as well, which should enable me to write a bit more than I have been.
